result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Yang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Delivery Of Methamphetamine(>50g), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)4.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court orders repayment of buy money in the amount of $3000.00
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, buy money and surcharges including DNA surcharges.  To be paid during period of probation.  If revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC.  Remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Maintain full time work or school or combination of both.

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Not to reside or be present where illegal drugs are present in any building and or vehicle.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety.

charges.descr: Possession With Intent To Deliver  Narcotics

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Yang

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas Yang in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Thomas Yang in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 2 and 3 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 5 YEARS, consecutive to any other case, credit for 0 days time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:
- Serve 4 MONTHS STRAIGHT UPFRONT condition time in the House of Correction,
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain full-time work or school or combination of both. 
- Not to reside or be present where illegal drugs are present in any building and or vehicle.

- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, buy money and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court orders repayment of buy money in the amount of $3000.00.
*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: 
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Jury instructions/ elements for plea hearing.

OFF THE RECORD:
Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court, defendant Thomas Yang not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held.  Defendant would like a plea/sentencing date. defendant to be produced for in person hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court, defendant Thomas Yang not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Arguments heard as to defense's bail motion. Court orders $5000.00 cash bail and all other conditions of bail remain. Defense requests additional time. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas Yang in court, defendant in custody with attorney Colleen A Taylor appear by video. Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Scheuring.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 4.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

JUDGE FEISS, BRANCH 46 FOR JUDGE HANRAHAN, BRANCH 4.
Defendant Thomas Yang in Court with Attorney Thomas Holland Reed on behalf of the Public Defender's Office.  Defendant Thomas Yang in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski on behalf of Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Attorney Reed advised the COurt that ATTORNEY COLLEEN TAYLOR will be appointed to represent Mr. Yang. Due to Defendant's Cash Bail, Court rescheduled Preliminary hearing. State requested an afternoon hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 4. 
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm before Commissioner Phillips.

Order to Show Cause hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Judge Feiss will handle the hearing for Judge Hanrahan.
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference. 
Information provided to Public Defender's Office.

Defendant Thomas Yang not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V-LEE Hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas Yang not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  SPD has not appointed counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas Yang not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed consel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Oral No Contact Order with K.A.S.

Defendant Thomas Yang in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Thomas Yang in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thomas Yang appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
